title: Multi-Language Analysis Book
text:
1 Welcome
This book demonstrates how to use Python and R together in Quarto, passing variables between languages for reproducible analysis.

title: 2  Introduction
text:
2.1 Python Example
This chapter introduces the basics of cross-language computation in Quarto.
Code
x = 42
print(f"Python variable x: {x}")


Python variable x: 42

title: 2  Introduction
text:
2.2 R Example


Code
y <- 3.14
cat("R variable y:", y, "\n")


R variable y: 3.14

title: 3  Passing Python Variable to R
text:
3.1 Python
Here we define a variable in Python and use it in R.
Code
my_value = 100
crumbs: 3  Passing Python Variable to R

title: 3  Passing Python Variable to R
text:
3.2 R (access Python variable)


Code
py_my_value <- py$my_value
cat("Value from Python in R:", py_my_value, "\n")


Value from Python in R: 100
crumbs: 3  Passing Python Variable to R

title: 4  Passing R Variable to Python
text:
4.1 R
Here we define a variable in R and use it in Python.
Code
my_r_value <- 7
crumbs: 4  Passing R Variable to Python

title: 4  Passing R Variable to Python
text:
4.2 Python (access R variable)


Code
my_r_value = r.my_r_value
print("Value from R in Python:", my_r_value)


Value from R in Python: 7.0
crumbs: 4  Passing R Variable to Python

title: 5  Summary
text: This book showed how to organize a Quarto HTML book and pass variables between Python and R in each chapter.
